voice: I have the power to go this way.
display_name: Channel of the Beat (2–14) — Keeper of the Keys
keynotes: sacral fuel serving the self’s geometry
the one who knows where the power goes
the beat: fixed rhythm, fixed direction
can hold or release resources for others
melancholy when direction has no outlet
notes:
Overview: Channel 2–14 links Gate 2 (The Direction of the Self / The Driver) in the G Center with Gate 14 (Power Skills) in the Sacral. In Human Design this is the classic Individual ‘Beat’ — the pulse of the Knowing stream. It is often described as “the design of a keeper of the keys” because this configuration knows who the energy and resources are for, and in what direction they should move.

Mechanics:
- Gate 2 provides the **direction** — the correct geometry for the vehicle, guided by the Magnetic Monopole in the G.
- Gate 14 provides the **fuel** — the sacral power to do the work, to accumulate, to sustain, to make resources available.
- Together they create a person who is not only resourced but also **correctly guided**, so the power doesn’t spill into the wrong places.

Line Companion / Jovian-style pulls (≤25 words):
1) "Gate 2 is the driver of the vehicle." — Ra Uru Hu, Line Companion (Gate 2)
2) "Receptive to the direction of the Self." — Ra Uru Hu, Line Companion (Gate 2)
3) "Gate 14 is the power to sustain direction." — Ra Uru Hu, Line Companion (Gate 14)
4) "This is the keeper of the keys." — Ra Uru Hu, Channel 2–14
5) "Resources are for those who are correct." — Ra Uru Hu, Line Companion (Gate 14)

Interpretation of these quotes:
- The **2** does not invent direction; it receives the correct one from the Self.
- The **14** does not chase money for ego; it fuels what the Self has already oriented toward.
- The channel’s gift is not merely to have energy, but to **steward** energy.

Aura / type considerations:
- This is a Generator channel (G ↔ Sacral, no Throat), so the purest strategy is to **wait to respond** and then apply power to the correct direction.
- If it initiates without response, it can waste its very potent resources or empower the wrong person.

High expression:
- Reliable, rhythmic, materially capable.
- Knows which projects deserve power and which do not.
- Can materially support a collective or tribe while remaining individually directed.

Low expression / distortion:
- Hoarding resources out of fear.
- Power feeding the wrong direction (distraction, other people’s agenda).
- Feeling stuck because there is no outer opportunity to move in the correct geometry.

Notes on ‘the Beat’:
- “Beat” here is both literal and symbolic — an internal, fixed frequency that does not like to be pushed off time.
- When the world’s rhythm matches the 2–14 rhythm, there is a sense of effortless movement and prosperity.
- When it doesn’t, sadness or melancholy can arise — classic Individual chemistry.

Ideal environment / role:
- Roles where you **direct resources**: operations, provisioning, patronage, guardians of assets, people who say “yes” or “no” to projects.
- Roles where your **inner compass** matters more than outer trends.
